Summary Over 15+ years of experience as a technology executive and GTM leader in software, hardware and cloud companies small and large, I have conceived, developed and scaled go-to-market teams and efforts from scratch to industry-prominence across companies and their ecosystems to maximize strategic and financial impact.  
 
Recognized for my "player-coach" leadership style, and for my ability to motivate diverse cross-functional groups to deliver results and exceed defined business objectives 
 
Strong verbal and written communications skills, articulate speaker, clear and concise writer, prepare and deliver effective presentations, high quality documents and correspondence.  
 
Proven track record of successfully conceiving, developing and managing product development schedules and marketing programs that meet and exceed business objectives.

Deep experience working in and with sales organizations, coupled with my strong business and technical background enable me to quickly and effectively translate market requirements to product development and winning go-to-market strategies.    Experience Sr. Director, Marketing Strategy & Programs NetApp May 2008  –  May 2014  (6 years 1 month) Sunnyvale, CA •	Transformed and led worldwide product and solutions marketing for all NetApp OEM’s, E-Series & EF-Series product platforms that drive revenues. Ran global, distributed team of 12 responsible for all aspects of portfolio, platform and solution go-to-market positioning, messaging, thought leadership, field and channel partner enablement and demand generation worldwide. 
•	Conceived and drove NetApp’s 150-person E-Series & EF-Series initiative, which set a new industry standard for SAN and Flash performance storage, defined our GTM pitch, lead generation, and thought leadership efforts, and delivered 20+% growth. 
•	Collaborated with several teams of product managers and technical product managers to drive requirements and strategic product direction for the E-Series & EF-Series product lines. Responsible for the roadmaps and direction of the products. 
•	Drove the overall product management release process including prioritization of requirements, business case analysis, market alignment and determining the most optimal release schedule within NetApp and the OEM’s. 
•	Developed and established a mobile platform for content delivery for NetApp direct and channel sales organization. Worked with ChannelRocket (startup company) to define product requirements, schedule and delivery of platform. 
•	Responsible for NetApp’s OEM business partner strategy of delivering NetApp's leading storage technologies through non-NetApp branded pathways. Significant partnerships included IBM, Dell, Teradata, SGI, Oracle, and many other smaller vertical and horizontal application providers.  
•	Established customized OEM go-to-market programs to create brand preference for the NetApp products through the OEM business partner channel.  
 
  Director, Strategic Products Program & Training NetApp May 2007  –  May 2008  (1 year 1 month) Director, System Engineering & Professional Svcs Decru March 2005  –  May 2007  (2 years 3 months) Redwood City, CA •	As a startup business, Decru required seasoned experience in developing and establishing processes for Enterprise Storage sales. Developed and drove a global team of 15 establishing sales, consulting and educational processes for Storage Security.  
•	Responsible for establishing Decru’s product strategy and leadership position in the storage security marketing through customer-focused go-to-market programs for both commercial and government sectors. 
•	Developed significant alliance partnerships with leading storage providers (NetApp, EMC, Symantec, Brocade) to strengthen product interoperability and improve product quality.  
•	Cultivated alliance partnerships to establish new pathways for selling through channel partners and service providers through joint go-to-market programs. 
•	Conceived and drove a $10M P&L hybrid organization of global System Engineers and Consultants driving revenue and delivering services in the Storage Security Market. 
•	Led and transformed the Decru business to NetApp in August 2005 by integrating the organization and processes. •	Conceived and drove a global team of 10 establishing new go-to-market processes resulting in a 45+% improvement in sales efficiencies resulting in improved customer uptake of new products (within 3 weeks of a launch) and increased revenue of over $15M.

Summary Patrick currently is responsible for defining the Bay Trail-M SoC platform plan of record, extended platform features, OS support and platform positioning. He received an Intel Achievement Award, Intel's highest honor for his part in pulling in the product ~4 months and ramping volume that exceeded expectations. 
 
He is also currently responsible for Intel's 2016 entry segment platform product marketing activities. 
 
Patrick has been at Intel for 19 years doing a variety of roles, including roles in the Desktop Client Platforms Group, where he owned delivering Intel’s first USB 3.0 solution to market with the Intel 7-Series Express Chipset, and drove the OS strategy/readiness for the 7-Series and 8-Series based DT platforms. Summary Patrick currently is responsible for defining the Bay Trail-M SoC platform plan of record, extended platform features, OS support and platform positioning.
